body_html:
I already tried your suggestion and it outputs the same error. My target is an integer representing an index class. The output of the network is a vector as large as my vocabulary and it is the output from log_softmax. I'll attach my encoder and decoderrnn, but they are very similar to those from the seq2seq example from pytorch tutorials

attndecoder (copy).py.txt
encoder (copy).py.txt

body:
I already tried your suggestion and it outputs the same error. My target is an integer representing an index class. The output of the network is a vector as large as my vocabulary and it is the output from log_softmax. I'll attach my encoder and decoderrnn, but they are very similar to those from the seq2seq example from pytorch tutorials

[attndecoder (copy).py.txt](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/1689554/attndecoder.copy.py.txt)
[encoder (copy).py.txt](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/1689555/encoder.copy.py.txt)
